record.title: HONORING THE LIFE OF SERGEANT WILLIAM "BILL" ZAPFE
record.narrative:
HONORING THE LIFE OF SERGEANT WILLIAM "BILL" ZAPFE -- (House of Representatives - July 17, 2007)

[Page: H7858]
(Mr. DAVIS of Kentucky asked and was given permission to address the House for 1 minute and to revise and extend his remarks.)

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, I rise this morning to honor the life of Sergeant First Class William "Bill" Zapfe. Sergeant Zapfe was serving with the Army's 3rd Infantry Division as a combat engineer when he was tragically killed by an improvised explosive device last month. Sergeant Zapfe was a dedicated soldier on his third tour in Iraq.

Bill grew up in Park Hills and Dry Ridge, Kentucky, and joined the military shortly after graduating from high school. He came from a family of dedicated public servants. His late father, Joseph, was a State trooper, and his two brothers, Joseph and Edward, have also both dutifully served our Nation. He is remembered by his family as a loving and devoted husband and father. Bill Zapfe is a true patriot who died fighting for a cause he believed in. Bill leaves behind his mother, Jeanne; his loving wife, Evelyn; and his three children, Anastasia, Cameron, and Spencer.
Today, as we honor the life of Sergeant Zapfe, our thoughts and prayers are with his family and friends during this difficult time.
We thank Sergeant Zapfe for his service and for answering the call to protect our great Nation.
